New Records: It was the first time both Indian openers were dismissed for a duck since 1983 in a World Cup match.
This marks the first instance in ODIs where India has seen three batters out of their top four dismissed without scoring.
Key Match Events: Ishan Kishan was out for a golden duck in his World Cup debut.
Rohit Sharma was out for 0 after facing 6 balls in Chennai.
Josh Hazlewood and Mitchell Starc ran through the Indian top-order on Sunday.
Rohit Sharma, Ishan Kishan and Shreyas Iyer did not trouble the scorers at the MA Chidambaram Stadium.
Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood left the Chepauk crowd speechless with their approach in the first 3 overs of the Indian chase.
Rohit Sharma also joined an unwanted list as he became the third India captain to get out for 0 in a World Cup match.
Ravindra Jadeja shone with the ball, picking up 3 wickets as India bowled Australia out for 199.
Kuldeep Yadav and Jasprit Bumrah picked up 2 wickets each while R Ashwin and Mohammed Siraj chipped in with a wicket each.
